title: TestConnectionDefinition
description: TestConnection is the definition that will encapsulate the steps required to test a connection to a specific service.

testConnectionStep.description: Function that tests one specific element of the service. E.g., listing schemas, lineage, or tags.

name.description: Name of the step being tested

description.description: What is the goal of the step

errorMessage.description: In case of error this message should be displayed on UI, We define this message manually on test connection definition

mandatory.description: Is this step mandatory to be passed?

shortCircuit.description: This field if set to true, indicates that the step is important enough to break the process in case of failure.

id.description: Unique identifier of this test case definition instance.

name.description: Name of the Test Connection Definition. It should be the `type` of the service being tested, e.g., Mysql, or Snowflake.

displayName.description: Display Name that identifies this test definition.

description.description: Description of the test connection def.

steps.description: Steps to test the connection. Order matters.

items.title: Entity Reference
items.description: This schema defines the EntityReference type used for referencing an entity. EntityReference is used for capturing relationships from one entity to another. For example, a table has an attribute called database of type EntityReference that captures the relationship of a table `belongs to a` database.

id.description: Unique identifier that identifies an entity instance.

fullyQualifiedName.description: Fully qualified name of the entity instance. For entities such as tables, databases fullyQualifiedName is returned in this field. For entities that don't have name hierarchy such as `user` and `team` this will be same as the `name` field.

displayName.description: Display Name that identifies this entity.

deleted.description: If true the entity referred to has been soft-deleted.

inherited.description: If true the relationship indicated by this entity reference is inherited from the parent entity.

updatedAt.description: Last update time corresponding to the new version of the entity in Unix epoch time milliseconds.
updatedAt.@comment: Note that during code generation this is converted into long

impersonatedBy.description: Bot user that performed the action on behalf of the actual user.

href.description: Link to the resource corresponding to this entity.

changeDescription.description: Change that lead to this version of the entity.

fieldsAdded.description: Names of fields added during the version changes.

name.description: Name of the entity field that changed.

oldValue.description: Previous value of the field. Note that this is a JSON string and use the corresponding field type to deserialize it.

newValue.description: New value of the field. Note that this is a JSON string and use the corresponding field type to deserialize it.

fieldsUpdated.description: Fields modified during the version changes with old and new values.

name.description: Name of the entity field that changed.

oldValue.description: Previous value of the field. Note that this is a JSON string and use the corresponding field type to deserialize it.

newValue.description: New value of the field. Note that this is a JSON string and use the corresponding field type to deserialize it.

fieldsDeleted.description: Fields deleted during the version changes with old value before deleted.

newValue.description: New value of the field. Note that this is a JSON string and use the corresponding field type to deserialize it.

previousVersion.description: When a change did not result in change, this could be same as the current version.
